result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan James Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 10 days Jail in lieu of costs, consecutive to sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan James Peterson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ryan James Peterson in court in custody with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleas no contest, court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders 90 days jail and in lieu of payment of costs 10 days jail, consecutive.  103 days credit.
Defendant Ryan James Peterson in court in custody with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on April 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Ryan James Peterson in court in custody with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Next court appearance to be set.
Defendant Ryan James Peterson in court in custody with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Gwanny J Tjoa appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calendar call scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ryan James Peterson in court in custody with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set.

Defendant Ryan James Peterson in court in custody with attorney Vanessa Paster.  Cheniqua White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  $150.00 cash bond set.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim, S.A., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.
